text:
I think their herbal chicken soup is done better than their turtle soup. Don't get me wrong, the turtle soup is decent, but far from great. It was light on the turtle meat, though they cooked it til it's soft, and the cartilage / joints were nice to chew on. However, the taste of the soup is too light, bordering on the blander side.

Not my favourite, but OK in a pinch. It's in a hawker centre, so don't expect an upscale ambience or anything. But they do close early, so maybe they do have a steady stream of customers.

Nowadays hard to find this traditional turtle soup stall, surprise to see it today! Try the $8 one, it was well boil and good portion. The soup fragrance stay for a long while. Highly recommend. The Chinese name is 国记山瑞。

My go to turtle soup.
Soup is fragrant and lady boss is humble.
The pricing is reasonable.
Friendly uncle and they customize the turtle for me, just skin and meat. Price has gone up due to inflation. But will still try to eat occasionally.

I bought a $10 per bowl turtle soup.  Herbal taste soup with pieces of meat enough to go with a bowl of rice. Soup can be refill but tasted different from the original so..not sure is it been diluted..overall, still consider good if you want to find turtle soup in toa Payoh
